DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Vaccines make person 's cancer cell may make body build immune response kill tumor cell . Combining vaccine therapy surgery may effective treatment pancreatic cancer . PURPOSE : Phase I trial study effectiveness vaccine therapy treat patient stage I stage II pancreatic cancer surgically remove .
DOC.brief_title: Vaccine Therapy Treating Patients With Stage I Stage II Pancreatic Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Study safety autologous tumor derive gp96 heat shock protein peptide complex ( HSPPC-96 ) patient resect pancreatic adenocarcinoma . II . Examine immune response HSPPC-96 group patient . OUTLINE : This dose escalation study . Six week surgery patient give autologous tumor derive gp96 heat shock protein peptide complex ( HSPPC-96 ) subcutaneously week 4 week . Five patient initially enrol two dose level . An additional three patient may enrol dose level determine optimal dose HSPPC-96 . Patients follow week 1 , 4 , 12 treatment . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A maximum 16 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically proven , resect , stage I II pancreatic adenocarcinoma PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Performance status : Karnofsky 70100 % Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : WBC least 3000/mm3 Lymphocyte count least 700/mm3 Platelet count least 100,000/mm3 Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Creatinine great 2.0 mg/dL Cardiovascular : No clinically significant heart disease Other : No serious illness No active infection require antibiotic within past 2 week Not pregnant nursing Fertile patient must use effective birth control No known immunodeficiency No active bleeding PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : No prior immunotherapy Chemotherapy : No prior chemotherapy Endocrine therapy : No concurrent corticosteroid Radiotherapy : No prior radiation therapy Surgery : Must undergo Whipple procedure distal pancreatectomy Memorial Hospital Must undergone splenectomy Other : No investigational treatment within 2 month surgery No immunosuppressive therapy
